name: Brown Sugar-Soy Glazed Meatballs
ingredients: 1/2 pound ground meat (beef, pork, or a combination)
instructions: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine the ground meat, breadcrumbs, minced garlic, grated ginger, salt, and black pepper. Mix everything well until fully combined.
2. Shape the meat mixture into small meatballs, approximately 1-inch in diameter.
3. Heat the vegetable oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the meatballs and cook until browned on all sides, approximately 8-10 minutes.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the brown sugar and soy sauce until the sugar is fully dissolved.
5. Once the meatballs are cooked, pour the brown sugar-soy sauce mixture over them in the skillet. Gently stir the meatballs to coat them evenly with the glaze.
6. Reduce the heat to low and simmer the meatballs in the glaze for an additional 3-5 minutes, or until the glaze thickens slightly.
7. Remove the skillet from heat and let the meatballs rest for a few minutes.
8. Serve the Brown Sugar-Soy Glazed Meatballs as an appetizer or main dish. Garnish with sesame seeds or chopped green onions if desired.
description: Brown Sugar-Soy Glazed Meatballs are juicy and flavorful meatballs coated in a sweet and savory glaze. They make a delicious appetizer or main dish, and the combination of brown sugar and soy sauce adds a delightful twist to this classic favorite.
